meanings.definition: Of or relating to Gaul or the Gauls.
meanings.sent1: The ancient ruins showed distinct gallic features.
meanings.sent2: The historian studied the gallic culture extensively.
meanings.sent3: The gallic warriors wore unique armor made of bronze.
meanings.sent4: Her gallic pride shone through in her traditional songs.
meanings.sent5: The gallic flag fluttered proudly in the wind.

meanings.definition: A native or inhabitant of Gaul.
meanings.sent1: The gallic welcomed the travelers with open arms.
meanings.sent2: Many gallic settled in the fertile valleys of Gaul.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous gallic children played pranks on each other.
meanings.sent4: She was a true gallic, fiercely loyal to her homeland.
meanings.sent5: The gallic shared stories of their ancestors around the fire.

meanings.definition: A style of architecture, art, or literature characteristic of the Gauls or their descendants.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed beautiful gallic sculptures.
meanings.sent2: The gallic paintings depicted scenes from ancient battles.
meanings.sent3: The quirky artist put a modern twist on gallic designs.
meanings.sent4: Her writing had a touch of gallic elegance and grace.
meanings.sent5: The play was a stunning tribute to gallic creativity.
